text: Wat Tyler (4 January 1341 â€“ 15 June 1381) was the leader of the English Peasant's Revolt of 1381. He died on 15 June 1381 at the meeting at Smithfield with the fourteen year old King Richard II. First, he was hit by William Walworth, mayor of London, and then one of the king's squires stabbed him in the stomach, killing him. == References == Category:1341 births Category:1381 deaths Category:Deaths by blade weapons Category:Assassinated English politicians Category:People from Kent
title: Wat Tyler
